greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered ways to write n as x^3 + y*(y+1)/2 + z*(3*z+1)/2, where x, y and z are nonnegative integers.
comment: Conjecture: a(n) > 0 for all n >= 0, and a(n) = 1 only for n = 0, 5, 12, 19, 20, 75, 83, 97, 117.
See also A262813 and A262816 for similar conjectures.
By Theorem 1.7(i) in the linked paper, each natural number can be written as the sum of a triangular number, an even square and a generalized pentagonal number.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, On universal sums of polygonal numbers, Sci. China Math. 58(2015), no. 7, 1367-1396.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Oct 03 2015
